Feminist Book Club
About Calendar

Week 2: Women’s Rights are Human Rights

Mar 2, 2015

This week we’ll be discusssing women’s rights from an international perspective.

Discussion Topics

  • Why are women and girls are still treated as second class citizens in most countries?
  • Why do you think there has been an out pouring of violence against women in 2nd and 3rd world countries in recent years?

This week’s featured book:

  • We Should All Be Feminists by Chiamana Ngozi Adiche

Additional content to read/watch:

  • Read/Watch Hillary Clinton’s speech “Women’s Rights are Human Rights” at the Fourth Women’s Confernce in Bejing, China in 1995
  • Watch Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie’s TED Talk
  • Watch Ziauddin Yousafzai’s TED Talk “My daughter, Malala”
  • Watch Malala Yousafzai’s Nobel Peace Prize Acceptance Speech
  • Read The Underground Girls of Kabul by Jenny Nordberg
  • Read “Indian Women Captured Fighting Off Sexual Attackers” from The Telegraph
  • Read “Indian Gang Rape: Six Men Charged with Murder” from The Guardian
  • Feminist Book Club

This is an eight (8) week book club/discussion group. Girl power!
